SMART Goal:
in order to enhance my decision-making skills with a focus on the ethical dimensions of my choices at work, i will develop and implement a personal ethics framework over the next three months. 

to achieve this, i will take the following steps:

1. **research and create a framework**: in the first month, i will spend at least five hours researching ethical decision-making models and best practices, focusing on literature that aligns with my workplace values. i will compile this into a concise framework, outlining at least three key principles that resonate with my role and responsibilities.

2. **implement the framework**: in the second month, i will apply this framework to at least three significant decisions i face in my job. for each decision, i will write a reflection on how the framework influenced my thought process and outcomes, ensuring i consider the ethical implications of my choices.

3. **seek feedback and adjust**: in the final month, i will share my experiences with a trusted mentor or colleague and request their feedback on my decision-making process. i aim to have at least one in-depth discussion where i can explore areas for improvement and refine my framework based on their insights.

this goal matters because it aligns with my commitment to personal growth and integrity in my professional interactions. by focusing on ethical dimensions in my decision-making, i will foster a work environment that values responsibility and trust. i will evaluate my progress by the end of the three months, determining how effectively i’ve integrated ethical considerations into my work and identifying next steps for continued growth.

SMART Goal: in the next three months, i will explore and integrate three new tech tools into my daily work routine to enhance my productivity and organization. specifically, i will research and select tools focused on project management, note-taking, and time tracking. i will dedicate at least two hours each week to experimenting with these tools, assessing their features, and determining their usefulness in my workflow. by the end of this period, i will measure the impact on my productivity by tracking the completion of my weekly tasks and evaluating my time management efficiency. this goal is important to me as i constantly seek ways to improve my work processes, and embracing new technology can lead to greater efficiency and job satisfaction. i’ll check in at the halfway mark, at six weeks, to adjust my approach if a particular tool isn’t meeting my expectations, ensuring i stay on track for successful integration by the end of the three-month period.
